changes.desc: With the advanced domain spells and the archetype feats finished, the core Cleric is now fully implemented. This seems as good a time as any for a new release.

Implementing advanced domain spells has added a lot of new and fun capabilities to conditions, including circular and automatically processing stages as well as a time stopping effect, that can be used in custom content.
The _className attribute is no longer required when creating custom content.

When dropping an item that comes with other items, a popup dialog will now ask you what do to with the included items, while giving some context. Previously, there were two alternative drop buttons that never seemed very clear in their wording.

Container items like backpacks will now get a similar popup dialog to choose whether to drop all contained items or dump them into your main inventory. If you sell a container or lose it as as part of a bundle (e.g. in the adventurer's pack), it will automatically be emptied first.
You can now grant yourself additional lore trainings in the bonus menu.

In the standalone release, the path of the local data file has changed to properly reflect the author and avoid conflicts with any similarly named publishers. The app will automatically attempt to move your file and cleanup the folder if it's empty afterwards.

Weapon traits that grant attack or damage bonuses can now be activated directly in the weapon entry in the attacks area, and will only affect that particular weapon. Previously, they were shown in the top of the attacks area and would affect all weapons sharing that trait.
Cleric Initial Domain Spells have been implemented. Any previously chosen spell will now be functional without any actions needed.

In the standalone release, a password can now be configured that all players need to enter before they can use the app.
If no password is defined in the config file, no password will be expected.
Because this is a fundamental security feature, PECS 10.0.10 will now only work with PECS Data Service 10.0.4 or higher, and vice versa.

changes.header: Messages moved out of the database
changes.desc: In the standalone package, inter-party message events are now handled in memory and don't use the connected database anymore. The messages parameter is not used anymore in the config file, and you can clear out the messages collection in your database. Going forward, messages will not persist when PECS is stopped.

changes.header: Default database moved from MongoDB to local file
changes.desc: The standalone package now uses a local data file instead of an external MongoDB. This file is saved in %appdata% under Windows and in HOMEDIR under Linux. You can still continue using a MongoDB if preferred. The executable will automatically migrate your existing characters from it if you keep your database connection configured and set ConvertMongoDBToLocal: true in config.json

The standalone executable now includes all the functions of the PECS data service, and does not need to connect to an external service anymore.
PECS still needs to connect to a MongoDB database running somewhere, but will handle its data traffic without the need for another service.
An external data service like the PECS data service can still be used in tandem if preferred.

PECS is now proudly available as an executable package from https://github.com/bukiro/PECS/releases. The included executables can be run on Windows and Linux, must be configured in a config file, and does not require node.js to be installed. The release still needs to connect to a data service for content.

The Cleric is now fully playable with all feats included in the Core Rulebook, but domain spells and Divine spells above 5th level still need to be implemented.
The domain feats and all spells can be taken, but they don't do anything yet.
The Divine Font feature options are be renamed to either Healing Font or Harmful Font on existing Clerics.

The Cleric can now be used as a class with all abilities and statistics. Most Cleric feats still need to be implemented and tested, and are not available to your character yet.
If you had already created a Cleric, the character will be patched the first time they are loaded. You may seem some feats and features be handled in a different way than before.
Certain feat choices can now automatically pick select a feat when only one option is available. These choices do not show as choices in that case, but are listed under fixed changes instead.
Items can now be moved between inventories with drag & drop.

Some held and worn items as well as rune and material mechanics have changed in ways that require characters' items to be patched. Worn items that grant innate spells used to be implemented with an activity that casts the spell. From now on, they instead grant real spells that are displayed in the Spellbook and the Spells area.
Rogues created before version 1.0.3 will have their "Racket" choice renamed to "Rogue's Racket" to match the correct class choice name.
Druids created before version 1.0.3 will have their "Order" choice renamed to "Druidic Order" to match the correct class choice name.
Players are now able to send items from their inventories to other party members.
Monks created before version 1.0.2 will lose their skill increases from Path to Perfection, and gain matching feature choices instead.
A Foundry VTT integration allows you to send your dice rolls to a FVTT session. This requires the External Dice Roll Connector module to be enabled in FVTT.
After applying some errata, certain containers have been removed, and all characters now receive a second default inventory for worn tools.

This is the first public version of PECS. Going forward, it will be assumed that people have created characters, and new versions will patch these characters to work with changes and new functionalities.
The App is fully functional, but with a lot of core content still to be implemented.
Development files have been cleaned out from the repository.
Members of the same party can target each other with benevolent spells, sending conditions and optionally sending turn start events that can end expiring conditions.
